title: Ticket #6184: Default annex should be restricted-use.
description:
There's no default mechanism to restrict an annex to the user who's paying for it, and the optional one is clumsy (requiring a partially-constructed config.d). Since the "personal annex" is a major use case (and of particular interest to Frank Wuerthwein), we should make this easy.

  1. Add a command-line option to restrict the annex to a given (list of )user(s). (e.g., START = Owner == ${USER} or START = isMemberOf( Owner, $(USER_LIST) ).)
  2. Make the current user's Owner value the default for this attribute. This may be trivial (getpwnam() or whatever HTCondor already does) or it could be complicated (which HTCondor daemon do we ask what our authenticated Owner attribute is?).
  3. Once we've done the above, add an option to avoid restricting the START expression for the (infrastructural) capability and capacity use-cases.
